content: Some bright spots during the quarter included, we exceeded our sales guidance for the quarter as the holiday season and in particular, January, played out better than expected in the U.S. We saw sales growth of 8.2% year-over-year in our European and Australian markets on a currency neutral basis. Other international net sales which consist of Europe and Australia, were $60.3 million, up 1.1% from last year. Looking at our full year results, net sales in 2022 were $958.4 million, a decrease of $225.5 million or 19% from $1.1839 billion in 2021. Other international net sales, which consists of Europe and Australia, were $156 million, up 1.8% from last year. Net sales for the 35-day period ended March 4, 2023, decreased 15.5% compared to the same 35-day period in the prior year ended March 5, 2022. From a regional perspective, net sales for our North America business for the 35-day period ended March 4, 2023 decreased 21.9% over the comparable period last year. But just as we look at the last 10 years, we've kind of had two troughs of right around 10% of sales is kind of where skate hardgoods and snow, we report them together, but the lion's share of what we're doing in the hardgoods category is skate.
